case_vignette: A 45-year-old man presents an urgent care clinic because he coughed up blood this morning. Although he had a persistent cough for the past 3 weeks, he had never coughed up blood until now. His voice is hoarse and admits that it has been like that for the past few months. Both his past medical history and family history are insignificant. He has smoked a pack of cigarettes a day since the age of 20 and drinks wine every night before bed. His vitals are: heart rate of 78/min, respiratory rate of 14/min, temperature of 36.5°C (97.8°F), blood pressure of 140/88 mm Hg. An indirect laryngoscopy reveals a rough vegetating lesion on the free border of the right vocal cord.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I coughed up blood this morning and I've had a persistent cough for the last 3 weeks. My voice has also been hoarse for a few months.
How old are you?
I am 45 years old.
Do you have a history of smoking?
Yes, I've smoked a pack of cigarettes a day since I was 20.
Do you have any history of lung disease or any other medical conditions?
No, both my past medical history and family history are insignificant.
Are you currently on any medications?
No, I'm not on any medications.
**Final Diagnosis:** Lung cancer, likely squamous cell carcinoma
